data.name: CountExceedsArrayLength
data.value: A count value was passed to a method that did not accept it as a valid argument, because the count exceeds the length of the associated array.

data.name: CountExceedsBufferLength
data.value: A count value was passed to a method that did not accept it as a valid argument, because the count exceeds the length of the associated byte array.

data.name: DateTimeMustBeInLocalTime
data.value: A date/time value was passed to a method that did not accept it as a valid argument, because the value is expected to be in local time.

data.name: DateTimeMustBeInUniversalTime
data.value: A date/time value was passed to a method that did not accept it as a valid argument, because the value is expected to be in coordinated universal time (UTC).

data.name: EmptyStringArgument
data.value: An empty string was passed to a method that did not accept it as a valid argument.

data.name: InvalidArgument
data.value: A value was passed to a method that did not accept it as a valid argument.

data.name: NullArgument
data.value: A null reference was passed to a method that did not accept it as a valid argument.

data.name: OffsetAndCountExceedArrayLength
data.value: Offset and count values were passed to a method that did not accept it as valid arguments, because the sum of offset and count exceeds the length of the associated array.

data.name: OffsetAndCountExceedBufferLength
data.value: Offset and count values were passed to a method that did not accept it as valid arguments, because the sum of offset and count exceeds the length of the associated byte array.

data.name: OffsetExceedsArrayLength
data.value: An offset value was passed to a method that did not accept it as a valid argument, because the offset exceeds the length of the associated array.

data.name: OffsetExceedsBufferLength
data.value: An offset value was passed to a method that did not accept it as a valid argument, because the offset exceeds the length of the associated byte array.

data.name: TypeMustBeAssignableTo
data.value: A value was passed to a method that did not accept it as a valid argument, because the value representing a type is not assignable to the specified target type {0}.

data.name: TypeMustBeSubclassOf
data.value: A value was passed to a method that did not accept it as a valid argument, because the value representing a type must be a sub-class of type {0}.

data.name: ValueMustBeAtLeast
data.value: A value was passed to a method that did not accept it as a valid argument, because the value must be at least (equal to or greater than) the minimum value of {0}.

data.name: ValueMustBeAtMost
data.value: A value was passed to a method that did not accept it as a valid argument, because the value must be at most (equal to or less than) the maximum value of {0}.

data.name: ValueMustBeGreaterThan
data.value: A value was passed to a method that did not accept it as a valid argument, because the value must be greater than the minimum value of {0}.

data.name: ValueMustBeInRange
data.value: A value was passed to a method that did not accept it as a valid argument, because the value must be equal to or greater than the minimum value of {0} and equal to or less than the maximum value of {1}.

data.name: ValueMustBeLessThan
data.value: A value was passed to a method that did not accept it as a valid argument, because the value must be less than the maximum value of {0}.

data.name: ValueMustBePositive
data.value: A value was passed to a method that did not accept it as a valid argument, because the value must be positive (equal to or greater than zero).
